1522222221.content: Will Gwen grow, or will the doctor shrink?
1522222221.title: Welcome to Torchwood

15222222212.content:
The TARDIS rumbles quite a bit as it tries its best to pull itself from the brownish-pinkish goo that it's stuck inside. As it shakes the goo breaks off of it, particles at a time. The Glarkarkeons glare angrilly at the stumbling ship, and do nothing out of respect for the man who only hours ago had invaded their terretory, appearing from nowhere and had "forced" them to wage war for their survival. Now he had just saved them, and the entire planet of Bargos, and even Trekleffi couldn't deny it. But that still didn't keep him from grinding his teeth at everything foreign.

On the inside, the Doctor and his old friend and companion, who he had recently needed to help him ... well, as the Doctor had said, "Let's just keep this between you and I so that we won't spoil the whole ... time vortex line of events, ok?" Of course, coming back from it, Captain Jack couldn't resist one final tag along. And who knew that the famed "Peace Planet of the Retrilian Universe" wasn't exactly that friendly? The things they teach you in school these days. They were just retreating from the planet, after saving it from the real invading spies who had used their deep unfounded aggression to plan a secret attack. They were pulling all the switches to try and get the TARDIS to fly up and out, and it was working, but slowly. The Doctor wasn't exactly pleased however.

"I thought I told you to keep the slime away from the TARDIS!"
"I was trying, but it was slippery. Almost reminds me of that visit to..."
"Jack! Keep your mind on the controls, we're almost out!"

They could feel the TARDIS lifting, hovering up above, shaking off all of the slime.
"I just hope it got it all." The Doctor growled slightly under his breath.
"I know the legends of what it's supposed to do, but what can it really do?"
"Ohhh, the legends are right. A little old, embellished, but certainly right. It can do just about anything. Not even it's guardians really know. It's said to have been able to contort the spine, shrink the mind .... and, oddly enough, give those who touch it an odd looking hair doo."
"Doesn't sound that bad," Jack grinned, "I've been looking for a new look!"
"Jack, we'd better be careful. This goo could cause catastrophic events ... we have to handle any remnants with deep caution."
"Oh... I know someone who can help." Jack smiled.
15222222212.title: The Doctor Shrinks

choices: Stay inside and fix the TARDIS
152222222121.content:
The TARDIS materialized on a humongous dark gray plain that seemed to stretch on for miles. There were no buildings, only huge walls that seemed like mountains to any visitor. It looked as though this place had never seen any tourists, however.

The Doctor lost his almost optimistic grin as he saw where he was when he stepped out.
"This isn't Cardiff, Doctor. Did you forget to check the Navigation Sequence again..."
"It's fine. I've checked it." The Doctor scowled, confused at the turn of events. He then went inside the TARDIS, as Jack stayed outside and looked around.

"We're a couple hundred meters away from our destination. I wonder why?" The Doctor looked around for an answer.
"You think the slime affected the TARDIS?"
"Could be... maybe we could target someone. See if the whole thing's gone."
"Yeah ..."

They ran back inside and the Doctor set it to Gwen,
"Uh, make sure you're not too close. I don't want to wake her up ... and I definitely don't want a flat team member." Jack added with a grin.

The TARDIS set off again. This time touching ground on a dark, dank, enclosed area resembling a tunnel. Seeing their surrounding, again they both scratched their heads as to why they were here.

"Maybe she's here somewhere..." Jack wondered, and began calling her name, as the Doctor went back inside the TARDIS to do another diagnostic check.

"GWEN! GWEN!" Jack yelled out, a couple of times, mostly not hearing a single other noise as his voice echoed throughout the tunnel. It seemed like they were in the sewers, as a slight odor permeated throughout the tunnel. Jack couldn't quite place what is.

He was about to give up yelling when, all of a sudden he heard a faint yell of "Rhys" It sounded just outside the tunnel. It was distinctly Gwen. Jack ran inside to tell the Doctor what he had just heard. The walls of the tunnel weren't very high and he planned to climb over them. The Doctor....
152222222121.title: Where's Gwen?

1522222221212.content:
The doctor didn't follow however. He stayed inside trying to find a way to fix the TARDIS. He hoped Jack's friend could help, but he couldn't wait to get it going again. What would happen if they needed the TARDIS? He was examining it, twisting knobs, and turning dials, reversing polarities here and there, and nothing seemed to be working. Maybe the ancient guarders of the sludge that had hit them knew what to do.

Meanwhile, Jack had successfully climbed over the sturdy yet soft and pungent walls and then simply let go and fell to the ground, almost like flying. It was fun from this height. He landed on a red soft, but dusty, carpet at the bottom. The blades looked like old and musty weeds found on strange planets, but somehow Jack could feel that these weeds were a bit too close to home.

All of a sudden there were massive quakes and creaks and then two loud booms hit the ground. Jack heard a frightening roar throughout the land, echoing against the sky. Then a loud, powerful and ever present godlike voice spoke, in a welsh accent,

"HMMMMM...... I THOUGHT I HEARD SOMETHING..... GUESS IT WAS A BAD DREAM.." Jack then, gazed upwards into the sky to see a sight that filled with extreme fear, and a strange sense of joy. He then looked around him and saw the slow wiggling of the purple and red. He put two and two together and yelled as loudly as he could.

Meanwhile, the doctor was confused by the yelling, and the earthquakes, and all of the noise going on outside. He figured that this Gwen must've been a very loud person or something. Or possibly that Jack had just done something stupid. He was concerned and so tried quickly to work out what he could in the TARDIS... but his thoughts were interrupted as he felt his ship leaning side ways and falling along ways. But the fall was not vertical, but at an angle. Worried, the Doctor opened the TARDIS doors to look out at the situation, and formulate a plan. But instead of finding Jack or a Kwalerian Centaur Beast from the Fourth Templaro of Csal, he was greeted with a huge purple and red stripped fuzzy long creature wiggling its five covered limbs and coming closer and closer towards him at every slide.

The Doctor stood there awesruck and bewildered at the new being, unsure what to do first; while Jack knew what was going on and ran towards the "tunnel". Jack tried yelling as he heard from above another loud speech,

"RIGHT... IT FEELS GOOD PUTTING THESE SHOES BACK ON ... FEELS GOOD TO GET BACK TO WORK..."
1522222221212.title: A new beautiful creature

choices: Stay here, and talk to the doctor
15222222212122.content:
"Gwen! Gwennnnnn!" Jack yelled while hopping up and down beside her as she slowly began getting up from her bed. He watched in fright as her gigantic, powerful leg draped in fading jeans rose high above the skies, causing sprinkles of dirt and rubbish hiding in between the shoe's cracks to fall down like rain. As she pounded across the plains that were her bedroom, Jack followed closely by her monolithic black and white trainers, gushes of wind blowing against him from the colossal stomps.

Jack tried pounding the side of the trainers in hopes that Gwen might notice him all the way down there, but of course she didn't. She kept walking through the hallway, probably towards the door. She was going to go outside -a place filled with danger - massive rows of shoes stomping about, tires rolling by as quick as lightning. He had to get her attention fast, or he might be lost in the traffic of people and cars outside. But looking all the way up, past her legs, long stretches of arms, at the very top was her lovely angelic face, absolutely oblivious to his plight. How could he get her attention?

But then, as he was sprinting, he noticed no stomps alongside him. Looking back, and all the ways up, he could see her holding a moment to think. This was his chance - as quick as a scurrying mouse, Jack climbed onto the old rubbery side of her shoe, and holding on tight to the little of the ledge he had, he pulled himself upwards, continuing to the top of Mt. Gwen.

As he reached the top of the shoe, he could hear,

"YEAH, I THINK I'LL JUST GRAB A QUICK CUP BEFORE I GO..." and the ride continued. Being on right on her foot, he was pulled all the way upwards into the air, hanging on tight, and then began falling way way down, hanging on for dear life to her fuzzy, warm sock. When the first stomp had finished, he hid under her pant leg, right near the warm sock, so that he could be safer from the crashing footfalls.

He waited it out, in the warm alcove until the steps stopped. It would now be safe for him to continue climbing up. But would that be a safe thing to do? Why not stay here and tell the doctor what's going on - he'd know what to do, wouldn't he? But maybe it'd be a good idea to get her attention, in case we need help from something of a greater size. Jack thought about it, and then took action...
15222222212122.title: The climb of your life

choices: The shadow is her finger, coming down to scracth an itch
The shadow is the underside of her shoe, coming to scracth her sock
152222222121221.content:
Jack decides that he'd better talk to the doctor, the doctor with all the answers. It seemed safer than trying to climb all the way up and hope that he could even get her attention. So Jack crawled a little bit closer to the inside of Gwen's shoe, the side of it, and began yelling out loud to his brilliant, but unseen friend.

"Doctor! Are you ok? Is everything alright down there?" There was no answer. So Jack tried again, this time louder, "Doctor, can you hear me?!" And this time, his voice echoed deep down into the trainer and bouncing off of her massive foot sent a muffled yell to the TARDIS.

Before, upon seeing the wiggling and ferocious foot, the doctor had rushed quickly back into the TARDIS, and had simply waited it out, trying to get it started again but to no avail. Meanwhile outside, the slender second toe and the heavy big toe of Gwen had surrounded the TARDIS and at every step the entire world of her shoe would tilt forwards, sliding the TARDIS back against the front wall, where the toes would squeeze it between them. The doctor was kind of dizzy from all of the walking and shaking, but was thoroughly excited when he heard Jack's voice. At least that meant that he had survived. He couldn't quite make out the words though, so the doctor instead pulled out a cell phone he had give Jack, just in case of emergencies.

While Jack was punching angrily against the mighty and impenetrable foot of Gwen, he unexpectedly got a phone call. Confused for a second, he then realized who it must be. Answering it he smiled and said,

"What are we going to do, Doctor?"
"What, no hello? No, how are you? No, how's it down there inside a stuffy old shoe?"
Jack laughs, and playfully adds,
"Well, how is it?"
"Oh, could be worse. All though, I have to say, it doesn't exactly smell like roses in here. Not that it stinks or anything, it's just a bit strong. This is your Gwen, then I suppose?"
"Oh yeah, I could tell her a mile away. But what are we gonna do? Is the TARDIS functioning normally again?"
"Oh, no. It's actually stuck."
"Stuck?"
"Oh yeah. Won't move. Which given the effect the goop had, would mean that we have to get it to a place with as little living material as possible. And this isn't quite the place." Gwen starts absentmindedly shaking her foot a little, causing quakes for her two shrunken friends. Jack tries to hold on tight to the fuzzy sock,

"Well, how're we gonna get you out of there?"
"Well, you could try getting her attention, you know her, so maybe if you.."
"I'll try!" Jack immediately said and did the only thing he could think of at the time. He began punching once again against her foot, hoping that she would notice him.
"...That was just one suggestion.." The doctor tried saying over the phone, "I'm not sure if you should go right ahead and.."
But looking up Jack could see it had no affect on Gwen's face, she looked straight ahead, not noticing anything down at her feet. He was about to try another suggestion when he saw, out of the blue, a shadow hovering over the sock that could only belong to Gwen....
152222222121221.title: What's up, Doc?

choices: Jumped onto her finger just in time
1522222221212211.content:
Jack looks in horror as a long light index finger lowers down at a quick speed right onto him. Its as quick and unseen as a bomb, and twice as powerful. Luckily for Jack, she only gently rubs the sock all around, deeply, to try and eliminate that annoying itch. Unfortunately however, these "gentle" strokes were smothering Jack between the smooth and silky ridges of an enormous index finger and the soft fluffy dyed cotton of her warm stripped sock. It did hurt a lot, and would've possibly killed anyone else, but this was Jack, and of course, this wasn't the only time he'd been close to death.

After a few moments of pain, the finger was lifted upwards and began flying back into the sky. But Jack acted quickly, and thought about hopping on the finger for a ride. If he was on her finger, then he could probably much more easily be able to get her attention. Since getting her attention was key, Jack needed to do this.

But then again, it might be dangerous and although, he could never die, he might be in no condition to help the doctor escape from his stuffy tomb of doom. He thought about falling far down, and then basically losing any chance he had of getting her attention. Having to start all over again from the very bottom. But the finger was starting to rise up fast now, so he'd better make his mind up quick.

Jack acted quickly and...
1522222221212211.title: Hitchhiker?

choices: Jack continues to hang onto Gwen's finger
15222222212122111.content:
Just as the peach-coloured pillar extended up, Jack flung himself at it, barely managing to grab onto the small but sturdy edge of Gwen's fingernail. As her finger rose at great speeds, the wind rushed passed him as he scooted himself up, now having tight fists full of the fleshy underside of her index finger. Jack felt a very uneasy feeling, as he opened his eyes to stare down upon a gigantic kitchen table, suspended just below a goddess,s chin by her mighty yet elegant digit.

Up above the monolithic woman exhaled deeply, blowing gusts of wind all across the land; causing dark red tidal waves in the ceramic stadium below. Then the ride got even bumpier as he hung on for dear life, as his vehicle cascaded down into the the sea of tea at a very daunting angle. Jack belted out a "Whoa, Nelly!" loudly as if calling a horse, to try and keep his cool.

The searing hot rows of steam flew at him as his journey ended just barely before the ravine. He waited, still hanging onto her finger, as Gwen just casually held her cup. But Jack didn't even get time to recuperate before the entire stadium, his ride, and himself were jolted upwards into the heavens to greet a glistening pair of lips parting contemplatively to make sure everything was ready before swallowing her ocean in one mere gulp.

Without warning, extremely strong gusts of wind battled and battered anything standing in it's way. Toppling everything to the ground, to the devilishly hot pit below. Jack held on as much as he could, but was caught unaware. As he smelled Gwen's strange odored morning breath wheeze over him, he could barely hold on, Hurricane Gwen might have had the better of him...
15222222212122111.title: Morning Breath

choices: Jump out of the way fast!
Didn't make it and was swept up by the toast...
152222222121221112.content:
Unfortunately Jack plummeted down into the searing hot lake of tea below, scalding splashes burning his face. "Yow!" he screamed out in pain, "Doesn't look good," Jack muttered as he was left afloat in her cup. He looked up to see her massive menacingly gorgeous goddesslike hill that was her bottom lip lower and give him a very clear, much too close view of her monolithic rows of bonelike teeth and the pink fleshy walls of her cavelike mouth. As the tide met her lips the sea was sucked into her mouth by her powerful vacuum.

Jack found himself helplessly being drawn in as he yelled out to her, "Stop! Gwen! We need your help!" but she wouldn't stop as she continued to innocently slurp. Jack had been whisked in with the rest of the current. He struggled to swim backwards but it too much. He grabbed onto the inside of her lip as long as he could, watching in horror as his sea was sucked down to the bottomless pit. But then suddenly, it stopped. The final trace of tea had gone down, leaving Jack intact but hanging.

"Well that's a woman who likes her tea," he tried ot joke to ease the troubles.As he waited there, he heard a loud goddesslike voice surrounding him utter "Oooh. Well that was good." It was so loud it almost broke his ears.

Afterwards Jack could only wait. He thought of trying to climb up, always a better idea to get up to her ears and try and tell her, than being stuck down in her mouth where he could be swallowed at any second. But looking down he realized just how far up he was. There was a slight bit of hesitation, but looking over he saw a humongous hand carrying a gigantic piece of toast right towards him, so he decided to...
152222222121221112.title: Jack almost gets drunk

choices: Yeah, I think she'd be great!
1522222222.content: Alright, how about Toshiko from Torchwood?
1522222222.title: Tosh?

15222222222.content: Why not River Song? I bet she'd do great!
15222222222.title: Riversong?

choices: "No idea. You get to choose this time, Doctor."
153121.content:
"Excuse me, Miss Oswald?"
Clara looked up from her book. "Yes?" A skinny red-headed boy held out a letter to her.
"Your Doctor told me to give this to you," he said, looking somewhat nervous.
"Thank you," Clara said, smiling as she took the letter. As soon as the letter had left his hand, the boy ran away like he was being chased. She put down the book and opened the letter. There was only an address, but an address was good enough for her. She got onto her motorcycle and drove away.
A few yards away from the address, she parked the motorcycle next to an old shop. It had rained last night, and the Doctor didn't like mud being tracked into the TARDIS.
The TARDIS was right in the middle of the road. It was a wonder that a car hadn't run into it. She ran up to the doors and pulled on the handles. They refused to open.
"Oh, come on!" She yelled at the blue box. "Let me in!"
The doors flew open, making her lose her footing. She stumbled inside, and the doors slammed shut after her.
"Sorry about that," the Doctor's voice drifted from below her. "She's crabby today."
Clara rushed down the stairs to where the Doctor stood, waiting, his arms open for a hug.
"What did you do?" Clara asked.
"Huh?" The Doctor lowered his arms.
"The little boy with the letter. What did you do?"
"I may or may not have materialized in front of him,"
"You're impossible."
"No, you are. How's my impossible girl been? Anything exciting happen while I was gone?"
"Nope. You?"
"Not a thing." The Doctor grinned, and Clara accepted his hug.
"Where are we going to go next?" She asked.
"Your choice," He said as he straightened his bow tie. "Where would you like to go?"
153121.title: Where to go?

choices: They are being pushed away by a barrier and the TARDIS is trying to get in
They are being pulled in and the TARDIS is trying to slow her descent.
They are now traveling backwards, into the past.
1531211.content:
The Doctor grinned. "The future it is, then!" He jumped up the stairs to the console, tripping on the way. Clara held back a laugh as he straightened up, attempting to make it seem like he meant to do that.
"So, how far to the future are we going?" Clara asked as the Doctor began to pull levers and press buttons so fast it made Clara dizzy to watch.
"Farther than you've ever gone before," the Doctor answered, grinning.
"Farther than I have? What about you?"
"Oh, I've been to the very end, and it's a bit dreary. We're just going a few billion trillion years in the future."
"Sorry? A few billion trillion?"
"Of course! The TARDIS can take us almost anywhere in time and space!"
"Alright then."
Just then, the TARDIS began to shake violently, sending the two occupants crashing to the ground. Lights began to flash, and sparks flew from the console.
"Doctor!" Clara had to shout over the noise. "What's happening?" She gripped the railing and hoisted herself to her feet.
"Two things could be happening!" The Doctor yelled. "Well, actually three!" He lunged for the console and pulled himself up. "One, we could be meeting some kind of barrier and the TARDIS is trying to get through! Two, we could be pulled in by something and the TARDIS is trying to slow down!"
"What's the third one?"
"The third one is that the TARDIS met with a repelling barrier, and we're now traveling backwards!"
"Into the past?"
"Yes! GERONIMO!" The Doctor laughed as Clara screamed, and she began to seriously doubt the Doctor's sanity.
1531211.title: Farther than you've ever gone before.

choices: Try to turn the wall off
Release time energy from the TARDIS
15312113.content:
Suddenly, the TARDIS gave a large jolt in the opposite direction, which sent the Doctor and Clara flying. The TARDIS spun so fast it made Clara dizzy. She clutched the floor, searching for a handhold. The Doctor tried to stand, but, having lack of coordination and two left feet, collapsed onto the floor again.
"Get to the console!" He yelled to Clara. "Press the big red button!"
Clara scrambled to her feet, trying to keep balanced. She lurched for the console and missed. She tried again, and managed to get a firm grip. She noticed the monitor and her stomach lurched. The TARDIS was spinning so quickly, it was creating a wall of time energy to protect itself. They were surrounded in a golden aura.
"Clara! The button!" The Doctor yelled.
Finding the button, Clara slammed her hand down on it and the TARDIS came to a halt.
"Where are we?" Clara asked the Doctor once he had risen to his feet.
"On Earth," he answered. "About a few million years in the past."
He pointed at the monitor. Clara gasped. Everything was huge! The trees, the animals, everything!
"Are there humans out there?" She asked.
"Of course! Maybe about fifty or so," the Doctor said.
"On the entire planet?"
"We're at the beginning of humanity, Clara," he explained. "It's very dangerous. We have to leave."
The Doctor pulled levers and pushed buttons. Nothing happened.
"She won't let us leave," he said. "Or she can't. Whatever it is, there's something here that we need to find. The air's breathable enough, so come on!"
The Doctor stepped outside and stopped.
"What's wrong?" Clara asked, peering over his shoulder.
"That." The Doctor stepped aside so she could see.
The wall of time energy was still there.
"How did that happen?" Clara wondered, watching the golden wall ripple in front of her.
"It's kind of like friction. The TARDIS was going so fast, it rubbed against time and space itself, creating a wall. The TARDIS absorbed as much energy as she could, so the wall is relatively thin."
"Okay," Clara said, still not understanding. "So how do we get through?"
15312113.title: Big Red Button

choices: The Doctor makes a sonic tool for Clara
They put their heads together and try to get out once again
153121133.content:
"It's time energy, so it won't hurt me," the Doctor said. "You've traveled in time, so it shouldn't be fatal, but I don't know what could happen."
"I'ts the only way to get out of here, so I'll risk it," Clara said, trying to mask how scared she was.
"I'll go first," the Doctor offered. He walked through the barrier, and it seemed to attract to him, but do nothing. He walked out.
"There," he said. "Come on."
Clara tried to slow down her heart rate. She stepped forward, and raised her hand to the wall. It looked solid.
"You can do it," the Doctor encouraged.
Clara took a deep breath and stepped through.
It was as though she was moving through jelly. The time energy swirled around her, and she felt it surround her. But it was different than when the Doctor went in. The time energy went inside her.
"Doctor? What's going on?"
"I don't know!" The Doctor said, looking worried. "Get out of there!"
Clara surged forward, arm outstretched. The time energy seemed to grab her and pull her backwards. The Doctor grabbed her arm and pulled, and Clara sprang free.
"I'ts okay now," Clara said, grinning up at the Doctor. "I'm fine."
"Well...Clara?"
"What?"
"Look down."
Clara looked down. Her entire body was glowing a faint gold. Energy streamed off her fingertips and into the air.
"What's happening?"
"Don't worry, Clara. It's okay. It'll end soon."
As he spoke, the golden energy began to grow thinner, until it dissipated into the cosmos.
Everything seemed sharper, clearer. Her mind was working almost a hundred times faster than normal. She turned to the Doctor, worried.
"Okay. What did that thing do?" She asked the Doctor.
"Feel your heartbeat."
Clara pressed a hand over her heart. It was thumping steadily, but she could feel the thumping of something else. She moved her hand to the right. There was another heart, beating inside her.
"I-I have two hearts," Clara said.
"The time energy altered you," The Doctor said. "You're not a human anymore, Clara. You're a Time Lord."
Clara didn't know what to think. She was a Time Lord.
"This is...this is..." Clara struggled to find the words to say.
"Exciting? Intriguing? Alarming?" The Doctor suggested.
"Impossible," Clara whispered. "Impossible, and awesome."
"I know," the Doctor said.
"Do I have to have a name like you?" Clara asked.
"Not if you don't want to," the Doctor said.
"I think I'll stick with Clara," she decided.
"You also have a secret name."
"I know."
"You're not going to tell me what it is, are you?"
Clara smiled. "Not a chance."
153121133.title: Another Time Lord

1531211331.content:
In travelling with the Doctor, Clara Oswald had learnt many things.

That most planets had an uncanny resemblance to Earth television studios, most alien cultures were homogeneous, and that humanity was seemingly the centre of the universe.

So being turned into a Time Lady? Not a huge surprise.

After they'd trekked through the wilderness, however, the two had come across a city populated by a race of angry blondes. Now that she had to conceded was maybe a bit unexpected.

"So who are they?" Clara asked as they were hauled away.

"Drahvin (https://tardis.fandom.com/wiki/Drahvin)." the Doctor answered. "Feminism taken to the extreme."

"I voted for Harriet Jones." Clara pointed out, as if to try and win points with the non-responsive guards. When they came to a fork in the halls, however, the two were forced apart. "Take the Time Lord to cell, take the Time Lady to the laboratory."

"What are you going to do with her?" The Doctor demanded. "If you harm her-"

"She will not be harmed. She will become essential to our expansion."

None too gently, Clara was shoved into a large laboratory and strapped to a metal table in an X-position. One of the scientists brought forth a small device. "Do you know what this is?"

Clara remained defiantly silent. "It is a Tissue Compression Eliminator (https://tardis.fandom.com/wiki/Tissue_Co...). Under normal circumstances, this machine shrinks down organic lifeforms. But if the polarity would be reversed, it can cause lifeforms to grow." With that, the scientist shoved the device down Clara's skirt and up her bum.

"AH! Bloody hell!" The former human cursed. "And why do you need me to grow?"

"We require the power of Time Lord regenerations to fuel our lifespans. But we need a large amount of your genetic material for our geneticists. And you're barely 5' 2"." Clara glared at the scientist. She hated jokes about her height. They made her so mad.

In his cell meanwhile, the Doctor paced as he wracked his brain to escape before he heard the sounds of a scuffle and bodies being tossed around before the door was kicked inwards. "Doctor come on!" Clara called.

"Clara how did you-" The Doctor trailed off when he saw his companion was now 15 feet tall, her clothes barely fitting her frame. "Explain later, run now." Clara said before she grabbed his arm and led him away.

"A TCE?" The Doctor asked when the two found an alley to hide in. Clara nodded. "Right, well I can probably get that out of you." Clara smirked a little as she thought of the Doctor hovering over her naked arse.

"Just don't get emotional." He said.

"Why not?" Clara asked, somewhat insulted. His reasoning became clear when Clara felt herself shoot up to 25 feet tall, her clothes ripping to shreds and letting the whole city see her naked body.

"That's why." He deadpanned as Clara lowered her hand for him to climb on. "Should I start running?" She asked as deadly looking ships advanced towards them.

"Not a bad idea." He answered. Not needing to be told twice, Clara bounded off, her massive size taking them across the city in seconds. Before they got out however, a ship fired an electric attack that struck her shoulder. Thankfully, her now Time Lady physiology allowed her to stay conscious but that didn't mean it didn't hurt.

"Clara," The Doctor began. "Stay calm. Don't-" The Doctor was cut off as Clara began to rumble again and doubled in size up to 50 feet.

Clara only spared a cursory glance at her body before she leapt over the city walls, through the wilderness, and back to where the TARDIS was.

"There is a slight problem." The Doctor said as she let him down near the TARDIS.

"Huh." Clara said as she started at the police box, now no bigger than an iPhone to her.

"I might have to leave you here." The Doctor said, looking up at the massive schoolteacher.

"WHAT!?" She screamed (making his ears ring) before she ballooned up to 100 feet. "This would be so cool if they didn't want to dissect me." She muttered as she laid down in front of him.

"Clara, listen. Time travel without protection is very dangerous. You could freeze, get ripped apart, burn, become a child, or even an old woman."

"Yeah but I'm huge now." She said. "I'm pretty sure I'll survive."

"I'm not gambling your life on "pretty sure" I lov... very much value you."

"Aww." Clara pouted, quickly picking up on what he'd meant to say. "I very much value you too." She planted a kiss on him. "But seriously, take me home." She pointed over her shoulder to the hovering ships. "They're coming."

The Doctor pondered what to do next.

1) He can't risk Clara. He'll come back for her but for now, she stays behind, trying to hide from the Drahvin while still growing. Her anger at being left behind causes her to grow to 200 feet.

2) They risk it and they wind up on Earth. But Clara's still growing and a threat to her fragile, little, planet.
1531211331.title: Captured

15312113312.content:
"Ok fine go." Clara conceded as she stood back up to her full 100 feet, her breasts jiggling with every thundering step she took.

"Ok." The Doctor said slowly, rather confused by how quickly she'd given in, as he entered the TARDIS. "I'll be back." With seconds, the capsule began its take-off only for a massive hand to grab it. "Gotcha!" Clara smirked as she vanished with it into the Time Vortex.

The Time Vortex was not something meant for mortal eyes (hence why most Time Tots went insane looking at it at the tender age of 8) and as she stared at it, seeing everything and nothing, every colour imaginable (and about forty eight that weren't), Clara's now Time Lady instincts told her that if she let go of the TARDIS, she'd never be seen or found again.

Before Clara could even shudder at the prospect, she felt gravity take hold of her as the TARDIS dropped back into real space. As she let go of the ship, she tried to shake loose the ice that had formed on her beautiful body but, not used to her new size, felt her sizeable rear cheeks slam themselves into her flat. "Well I'm not getting that security deposit back." She muttered as she sat down.

"You wouldn't have to worry about that if you'd listened to me." The Doctor scolded.

"Yeah wasn't staying there." Clara replied as she lifted the Doctor and the TARDIS up to a building for the sake of both their necks as she tried to curl in on herself. "So any ideas?"

"Well since you're so big, I can't materialize the TARDIS around you. So no using my lab." He muttered as he scanned her with his sonic. "I could try reversing the polarity of the TCE's neutron flow."

"First of all, neutrons don't have polarity and second please don't. Every time you suggest doing that, things wind up a thousand times worse."

"Yes well it's the best option we have right now. Not at your size, we'd need some special equipment so I suggest heading to UNIT."

"UNIT!?" Clara snapped, her voice cracking more than a few windows. "UNIT can't even navigate out of a paper bag. How can they fix this?" With that surge of emotion, Clara felt herself shoot up to 200 feet tall, her body smashing into the buildings in the alley. "At this point, I'll try UNIT." She conceded.

"Well I'll be doing everything via the TARDIS, I just need some backup equipment that they can provide." He explained before a silver light shot out from the TARDIS and struck the gigantic schoolteacher. "There. Perception filter so you can walk there no problem."

Clara pulled herself to her full height, debris falling off her, the Doctor now coming face to face with her womanhood. "Can I say that you seem very unfazed by this?" Her voice boomed from above.

"Well we've both seen weirder." He dismissed as he entered the TARDIS and vanished. Clara nodded her agreement.

Hesitantly, Clara took a few steps forward into London. She couldn't imagine what would happen if anyone she knew saw her like this. Much to her surprise however, no one paid her any mind. The cars below driving around her massive feet as though they were nothing more than potholes.

Now that she was a Time Lady, she felt no shame in saying it "Humans are idiots." She muttered as she walked. "Nothing to see here. Just a giant naked alien woman." She shouted to no reaction. With a mischievous grin, Clara smashed her breasts against the Shard, grinding up against the building. She could feel the glass, shattering against her flesh but no one even glanced at her.

"Right." She smiled as she skipped over more London landmarks, occasionally letting her thighs slam into something or flicking off the tops parts of building just to see if anyone would notice. If this was truly all it took to rain destruction across Earth, she truly wondered how the planet hadn't been conquered already.

She shook her head as she passed through an alleyway near Coal Hill, soon this would all be over.

What happens next?

1) Clara gets to UNIT but finds that the Cybermen have invaded, and are now targeting her.

2) While walking through the alley, Clara gets her inviting hips perfectly wedged between the buildings. While Clara grows even bigger to free herself, this shatters the perception filter and she's now visible to her nearby colleagues and students.
15312113312.title: Naked in London

1532.content:
Out in the middle of an open field, where high winds blew through out the area; a strange noise echoed all through out the place. Next to a running a running river, a faint light was shining through nothing and slowly, a blue box was slowly taking shape as came in focus. The noise died out as the light flashed away.

The blue box has a door which swung opened. Slowly a man leaned towards the entrance, holding onto the door for support. The man's whole head was glowing in very bright yellow light, making it impossible to see his face. His hands was glowing the same. The man suddenly lost strength as he fell forward and into the river.

As soon as the yellow light died down, the man climbed onto his hands and kneels and looked at the area he was in. He looked confused at what had happen and after a few seconds he remembered who he was and what had happened to him. The man took a deep breath as he looked at his hands as saw that they looked different than what he remembers them. "Now this is different" said the man to himself as he looked at the rest of his body.

The man then put his hands over his face and felt that it was different, he slide them higher and felt that is hair was also different. The man then looked down and saw his reflection of the water and saw a very different face. "Now that is different" said the man as he had a slight smirk on his new face.

The man looked like...
1532.title: A Non Canon Doctor

15321.content:
"My word..." said the man to himself as he grabbed hold of his nose and wiggled it. He noticed that he wiggled it very far, making it as if it was broken. "In all of my regenerations not once did I have a nose like this" said the man known as the Doctor. Doctor looked at his reflection again and saw that he has a slightly long ginger colour hair. He also saw that his eyes were deep blue.

Before Doctor could looked at his reflection some more it began to rain down hard. The Doctor looked up at the sky and saw that it was covered in dark clouds. "Charming" said Doctor as he smiled at the sky as the rain was falling upon his face. Doctor climbed himself up from the river and sat down on the bank. He fell onto back, while laying on the bank, he looked at the scenery, still with a smile on his face as he said out, "Charming in deed"

With that the Doctor just laughed as he climbed back onto his feet and then looked at the blue box known as the TARDIS. He walked towards the TARDIS and entered. "Hmm, where to go and who to see...." said the Doctor to himself as he walked towards the controls. "Ah I know" said the Doctor as he pulled some leavers, pushed some buttons and spinned some a helm like leaver.

With that loud noise began to echo all through out the TARDIS. "Well...what to do...what to do?" asked the Doctor as he looked at the damp clothes he was wearing. "Might as well have a change of clothes" answered the Doctor to himself as he walked towards the wardrobe room. He walked inside and saw that it was filled with clothes he once wore in his past regenerations . "Ah...this will do nicely" said the Doctor as he found some clothes he wish to wear.

After changing out from his wet clothes and put on his new clothes, the Doctor walked towards the controls and looked down at the clothes he was wearing which was a black pianist coat, a white shirt, baggy blue trousers along with black boots. "Hmm, not there yet" said the Doctor as he put his hands on his hair,"Might as well sort something out with this" as he grabbed hold of hair as he walked towards a mirror.

Standing in front of a mirror, he found a tub of hair gel, rubbed some of it together with his hands and slide them through his hair. Making the hair spiky, some of the spike lean forwards while the rest spiked backwards. Just then the noise that the TARDIS was making stopped. Doctor looked towards the control with a smile as he walked towards it.

"Finally here...where ever here is" said the Doctor as he had no idea where he set the TARDIS to be as he randomly send it anyplace as he couldn't decide where to go. "Well then, lets see where I am today" said the Doctor as he walked towards the doors and opened them to the unknown.
15321.title: Non Canon Doctor #1

153211.content:
"Well I say" said the Doctor as he took in the scenery. The TARDIS have landed within what he could tell was a deep forest. The trees grew tall, making it hard to even see the top. He saw what he could tell to be brown leafs falling down the tall trees, making him that it was autumn where ever he was located. The Doctor looked at the leafs and noticed that they appear to be larger then they should be. He took one step outside the TARDIS, breathed in the fresh air of the alien planet had to offer him.

He slowly made his way towards one of the large leafs, knelt down and picked on of them up. "My word...if I wanted to I could in fact turn one of these leafs into a kite..." said the Doctor as he examined it and saw that it was the size of kite. He looked around himself and saw that there were fallen leafs all different sizes. Doctor then dropped the leaf in his hands and slowly took a few steps away from it.

"Oh dear...oh deary me" said the Doctor to himself as he noticed that something doesn't feel right. "Well with that fact I'm starting to talk to myself this early in my new regenerated body," said the Doctor as he grabbed hold of his collar and he felt one of his two hearts hurting, "I knew I should have waited till I'm through progressing the regeneration stage" Once he finished saying that, when he hiccuped a mist that shone bright light escaped from him.

"Charming" said the Doctor as he hiccuped again and the same thing happened again. He rushed his way towards the TARDIS but with each hiccup cased him to feel weak with his legs. The moment that he reached the doors to the TARDIS, he felt himself spinning round, with his back against the doors and slowly slide down onto the ground. He kept on hiccuping as he looked up at the tall trees.

Just then he heard the sound of footsteps, he darted his sight towards where the sound came from and saw a silhouette which slowly grew large as it was heading towards him. The Doctor couldn't do anything, he felt weak and he had no strength left as each hiccup he did made him feel so. He eye sight went all blurry and then they grew heavy. Then everything went all black for him."Charming in deed" said the Doctor as he passed out.

Slowly he could hear a voice, the Doctor opened his eyes slightly and saw that he was no longer within the forest but he was somewhere else. Doctor took note that he was have been out of it for a few hours.

"Ah I see that you are awake" spoke a woman's voice.

The Doctor darted his eyes towards the owner of the woman's voice and saw that it belongs to...
153211.title: To a fantasy/demon like world

15322.content: The man looked like a lady. "Oh my, it's finally happened", she exclaims! Time Lords are unusual species in that they are all born male. Once they mature getting past their childish stage they become female. For most this is around the eighth or ninth regeneration, but for the Doctor it's taken a little longer. She slowly gets up examining herself in the process. "Oh my, these things are huge. A change of clothing is in order", the Doctor states while grabbing her chest. In reality they are not that huge, but for someone that has been a man for over 900 years it is a shock. The doctor gets up and strolls back into the TARDIS.
15322.title: Non Canon Doctor #2

15323.title: The Twelfth Doctor
